message.content:
cs.PL, cs.AR, cs.LO, cs.CR, cs.SE 

This paper deals with the problem of verifying safety properties of concurrent programs running over the Total Store Order (TSO) memory model. This topic is primarily related to programming languages (cs.PL) and architecture (cs.AR), as it involves understanding the behavior of concurrent programs and the underlying memory model. Additionally, the paper proposes a new load buffer semantics for TSO, which falls under the category of computer architecture (cs.AR) and logic (cs.LO). The paper also discusses the limitations of existing decision procedures, which is related to computer science theory (cs.CR) and software engineering (cs.SE).
